title: Natural Talent is worthless and needs to be buffed or replaced
body: I'm talking here about the Mastery. 10 AD and 15 AP at level 18 is completely worthless. 2% lifesteal and spell vamp might not seem like much more, but they have a greater impact, especially in the early game. Thus, I say Natural Talent should either be buffed or replaced entirely. A good buff would be making it so it gives a flat bonus which doesn't scale with level or downright increasing how much AD and AP it gives. As for replacing it, I suggest giving another survivability mastery to compete with the lifesteal/spell vamp one, though I can't think of one right now.

It's really not worthless.  Many champions use it in their highest winrate mastery setups.  I don't know the exact statistics overall, but it seems actually far more common in high winrate setups than Vampirism.  You can find reliable data at champion.gg  They use Riot's official API to track statistics from Platinum+ games.

You should keep in mind what it is competing with.  An equivalent tier mastery in the Defensive tree is only +45 max health for example.  +10 AD & +15 AP is a much higher total gold value than +45 Health.  
10 AD alone is worth 350g (a full {{item:1036}}).  
45 Health is only worth 120g total (less than a third of a {{item:1028}}).
Note that it's 10 AD at level 18, while you have that 45 health at the start of the match. That's what makes the whole difference.

I realize that, but if you value both AD and AP, then Natural Talent starts out with about the same gold value as Veteran's Scars.  If you value just AD or AP (have zero AP scaling for example) then Natural Talent still ends up worth more gold by like level 2 or 3.  Each point of AD is worth 35g, so it only takes less than 3.5 AD to equal to value of 45 Health (120g).  Having 5 points in Natural Talent gives +2 AD and 0.55 AD per level.  That's already 3.65 AD at level 3 without even considering the AP.

Sure, 2.5 AD and 3.8 starting AP isn't much, but it's competing with masteries that offer as little or even less.  Since Natural Talent is already showing up in a lot of the high winrate setups, the statistics suggest that it's not at all underpowered when compared to its competing masteries.  Buffing Natural Talent or replacing it with something more valuable would likely require buffs to all of the other tier 3 masteries.  When you examine the math, Natural Talent is actually probably somewhat overpowered compared to its competitors in all honesty, which is probably why it tends to show up in high winrate mastery setups.

Okay, I must have misread something.  I've taken another look and you are correct that the 2 AD was the level 18 value with 1 point.  Thanks.

If you value both AD and AP then it surpasses Veteran's Scars' gold value at level 3.2 (so let's just say level 4).  If you value just AD, then you need level 6.2 (so let's say 7).  

At level 4 for hybrid scalers, and most champions have some hybrid scaling, it surpasses the value of Veteran Scars.  At level 18, it ends up worth 5.6 times as much.

At level 7 for champions with zero AP scaling, it surpasses the value of Veteran's Scars.  At level 18, it ends up worth 2.9 times as much.

Honestly, that's not bad _**comparatively**_.  I'm not saying that there is no reason to ever choose the other options like Vampirism.  I am just saying that Natural Talent is plenty strong enough to compete with the other options available.  If Natural Talent were buffed, then the competing masteries in the same tier like Veteran's Scars would need to be buffed.  I personally wouldn't mind if that were done, but the thread should be "early masteries need to be buffed or replaced" in that case.

The AD and AP from Natural Talent usually represents a very small part of the damage a Champion does and that's why Vampirism is usually better.  The damage from Natural Talent doesn't usually significantly affect burst damage or last hitting and Vampirism is better for sustain between trades.

Champion GG masteries can be a bit misleading if you take them too literally because they don't actually show the winrate for specific masteries.  Instead, Champion GG shows the win rates for a couple complete mastery pages and Natural Talent is much less influential on the win rate of a page than other masteries (such as the keystone).  There are also a lot of hidden factors that are influencing the winrate for a mastery page.  Look at Champion GG as an indicator of strong trends but not necessarily as a confirmation of META.  You can't go very far wrong if you emulate strong trends, but it doesn't mean you are playing the best choices.

That said there are champions that benefit more from Natural Talent than from Vampirism.  Supports are an excellent example.  They don't get the gold to build a lot of AD or AP items.  They usually rely on both abilities and auto attacks for the damage that they do and it is much lower than what other champion do.  They don't hit minions very much (to benefit from Vampirism).  Definitely take Natural Talent on any support that goes into the Ferocity Tree.

I don't agree that it is useful on supports with spellthief's. Spellthief's provides an additional 10 damage for not just auto-attacks, but also spells. Already, the benefits from Natural Talent are negligible.

That said, I do agree that champs that scale with both AD and AP can use it well. It synergizes with Nashor's Tooth and anything attack-speed based (like rageblade as you mentioned).

Slow attack speed champions definitely benefit more from Vampirism than Natural Talent.
For example, Jhin has a slow attack speed.  If you go into the Ferocity Tree on Jhin, then you should definitely take Vampirism instead of Natural Talent.

If you play a champion with a fast attack speed build such as Kayle, then you might consider Natural Talent.  She builds attack speed and her basic attacks benefit from both AD and AP scaling.  With attack speed champions it is still a tough call to make between Vampirism and Natural Talent.  For example, Kog'Maw benefits from both AD and AP scaling on auto attacks and he builds attack speed.  But while Kayle has an ult that stops all damage, Kog'Maw does not.  I'd be curious to know what Kog'Maw mains think is the better choice for Kog'Maw: Natural Talent or Vampirism and what their reasoning is because the data indicates that most Kog'Maw players take Vampirism instead of Natural Talent while taking Fervor of Battle instead of Warlord's Bloodlust.  Kayle players take Fervor of Battle too but don't always take Vampirism.
